meanings.definition: The quality of being able to withstand exposure to various weather conditions.
meanings.sent1: The weatherproofnesses of the tent kept us dry during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The roof's weatherproofnesses ensured no leaks during the heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella's weatherproofnesses were so good, it even kept the sun off us!
meanings.sent4: Her jacket's weatherproofnesses were like a shield against the elements.
meanings.sent5: I wish my shoes had the same weatherproofnesses as my raincoat.

meanings.definition: The state of being resistant to damage or deterioration caused by weather.
meanings.sent1: The weatherproofnesses of the paint protected the fence from fading.
meanings.sent2: The weatherproofnesses of the car's exterior prevented rusting.
meanings.sent3: His hat's weatherproofnesses were so good, it stayed intact in a storm!
meanings.sent4: The weatherproofnesses of the house were like a shield against wear and tear.
meanings.sent5: The weatherproofnesses of the fabric made it last for years without damage.

meanings.definition: The ability to protect against rain, wind, and other elements.
meanings.sent1: The weatherproofnesses of the jacket kept me warm and dry in the rain.
meanings.sent2: The weatherproofnesses of the windows blocked out the howling wind.
meanings.sent3: The tent's weatherproofnesses were so good, it even kept out the bugs!
meanings.sent4: Her umbrella's weatherproofnesses were like a shield against the storm.
meanings.sent5: The weatherproofnesses of the roof saved us from the harsh elements outside.
